What information is included in the txt file provided with each download, and how can I use it to verify the download?

The txt file contains the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature. To verify the download, you can extract the downloaded archive, verify the signature for the extracted archive using the extracted text file, and then extract the archive to the desired directory.

## Verifying Downloads A txt file containing the signer, standard sha256 file checksum, and signature, is included for each download. These packages have been signed with the identity "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@". 1) Extract downloaded archive 2) Verify signature for the extracted archive using the extracted text file. 3) Extract archive to desired directory ### CLI examples **Verifying file directly** ``` ./verus verifyfile "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" AfQaEAABQR9cFt4qNU1KD14hlvClLhfICrm9LWuzcyW8Wh+zsu/BOQji9pUp0PRBnEEH4aQWlfRgeS4j2sByVDix3VMwj2aM /Downloads/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.7.0-3-amd64/Verus-CLI-Linux-v0.7.0-3-amd64.tar.gz ``` **Verifying using a checksum** ``` ./verus verifyhash "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" AfQaEAABQR9cFt4qNU1KD14hlvClLhfICrm9LWuzcyW8Wh+zsu/BOQji9pUp0PRBnEEH4aQWlfRgeS4j2sByVDix3VMwj2aM d509506edcf48a3ba64d814916f98e46105a0f6b437635cf5d2f2247e1574d7a ```**The result will be true if the signature is valid.** ``` true ```**MAKE SURE TO UPGRADE BY June 14TH, OR YOU MAY NEED TO RESYNCHRONIZE THE BLOCKCHAIN IF YOU ARE RUNNING IN NATIVE MODE.**At block 1053660, the Verus Mainnet Protocol will upgrade to the new Komodo Notary Nodes for Komodo dPoW notarization, season 4, and a number of new capabilities, as well as a change to the Verus Proof of Power staking and mining hash will go live on the Verus mainnet as well.## The network upgrade will activate the following features: - Added support for season 4 Komodo notary node operators- Coinbase shielding will no longer be required on any coinbases from the past that have not yet been shielded.- Staking will now work on all normal ID balances, enabling full use of IDs for storing and staking funds.- A new `sendcurrency` API for the command line provides more control when sending from and to multiple addresses or identities.- `updateidentity` will now be able to change the case of characters in the name of a VerusID in the global locale.- Revocation identity will now lose all control over an ID after revocation, including the ability to still change the revocation identity itself, which it used to retain. After revocation now, the recovery identity will have full control over the revoked ID.- Staking and hashing consensus protocol updates with VerusHash 2.2## Notable Changes: - Fix Komodo S4 notary count - `sendcurrency` does not require coinbase funds to be shielded.# Disclaimer
./raw_txt_input/release_notes.md
How can I verify a file directly using the CLI, and what is the expected result if the signature is valid?

You can verify a file directly using the CLI by running the command `./verus verifyfile "Verus Coin Foundation Releases@" <signature> <file path>`. If the signature is valid, the result will be `true`.

What is the purpose of the network upgrade scheduled for block 1053660, and what features will be activated as a result?

The network upgrade scheduled for block 1053660 will upgrade the Verus Mainnet Protocol to the new Komodo Notary Nodes for Komodo dPoW notarization, season 4, and will activate a number of new capabilities. The features that will be activated as a result include added support for season 4 Komodo notary node operators, coinbase shielding no longer being required, staking working on all normal ID balances, a new `sendcurrency` API for the command line, and updates to the `updateidentity` and revocation identity functionality.

What is the deadline for upgrading Verus Desktop, and what are the consequences of not upgrading by that deadline?
The deadline for upgrading is June 14th. If you are running in native mode and do not upgrade by this deadline, you may need to resynchronize the blockchain.
